intro: Lanonia dasyantha, commonly known as the woolly lanonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
